title: An Alternative for Constant Mean Curvature Hypersurfaces
abstract:
Let $M^{n+1}$ be a closed manifold of dimension $3\le n+1\le 7$ equipped with
a generic Riemannian metric $g$. Let $c$ be a positive number. We show that,
either there exist infinitely many distinct closed hypersurfaces with constant
mean curvature equal to $c$, or there exist infinitely many distinct closed
hypersurfaces with constant mean curvature less than $c$ but enclosing half the
volume of $M$.
